properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters of Tututila and Aunuu
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 17 at 7:26PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Gale force winds of 30 to 40 kts continue to threaten the coastal
waters extending 40 nautical mile from Tutuila through Tuesday,
as a complex environment within the active monsoon trough keeps
the possibility of a tropical cyclone developing near the
islands. Seas of 16 to 21 feet or higher will remain through
Tuesday, with higher seas near thunderstorms.

A gale warning means sustained winds of 34-47 kts (39-54 mph)
is either predicted or occurring, and not directly associated
with a tropical cyclone.

Gale force winds and dangerous seas could capsize or damage
vessels and the frequent showers could reduce visibility.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates.

You may also follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website
at www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Warning is in effect for coastal waters extending 40 nautical miles from Tutuila American Samoa
